Reviews.Title: “Best affordable five star hotel in Sultanahmet, just a block behind the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: PRATANA
Reviews.Content: It took me a while to finally pick a hotel in Istanbul for our 4 night stay and we was not disappointed to pick this hotel. First of all, the location is great, a block from the Four Seasons, 5 minute walk to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi and Sultanahmet Tram stop. The street where the hotel is located is lively, safe and full of nice cafe and restaurants, no need to wander around finding food elsewhere. The hotel is a small hotel with 2-4 rooms each floor in the 5 floors building. Half of the rooms face the street in front while another half face the back street with less view. The roof top offers view of the Bosphorus. The room is large, the bedding is very comfortable with 5 pillows, small sofa, writing desk. The bathroom is large with tub and heating towel rack. There is also a balcony in some room. Sometimes the hotel can be a bit noisy when there are lots of kids running on the corridor but I think that happens everywhere. The service is impeccable, hard to beat. The staff are always the same face so after a few days of staying there, you feel like home. They are friendly, honest and helpful. The breakfast was great with a lot of variety and you can order hot egg dishes on top. The hamam is also great with extra service for massage but the best I had on this trip (of 12 days and did several hamam with extra service.) I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: marciapisani
Reviews.Content: I am just coming back from this friendly hotel. The stuff is really very good. Since I was travelling alone, they try to give the best advices and nice places to go. It is a very clean, the Turkish Bath is just wonderful, as well as the massage. The Gym room is new and provide everything you need. They even bring to you a bottle of cold water. Since I am vegetarian, they take carry about my preferences and made very tasteful meals. The wine is good. It is close to the most important sites and they recommend the best tours and shows, arranging also the pick up and drop off. I hope to be back soon and I definitely recommend this cute and cozy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exellent stuff”
Reviews.Author: chris m
Reviews.Content: I Have just return from my stay in the hotel with my family.Very good,clean hotel,exellent stuff which made our trip easier with the right advices.Also very good location in the old city.Finally the restaurant serves very tastefull food. I definitely recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff but not so 'Premier'”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I found the staff here very helpful and friendly...one of the nicest I came across in so many hotels i stayed elsewhere. The location of this hotel is great...right smack in the middle of old town city and lots of resturants along the street. My only dissapointment would be that while it has the stated facilities, it is not as just not as Grand and Premier as one would expect of a typical 5 star hotel , but to be fair to the hotel, I read that the '5 star standard' in Istanbul varies from elsewhere. Don't expect a typical 5 star style Suite and Spa Hotel. I would give it 3.5 - 4 stars with great location and very helpful staff so if you consider this as a 3.5 - 4 star hotel when booking and you are happy with the room rates, then you certainly won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valeria A
Reviews.Content: I suggest this small and nice hotel to stay in Istanbul. Walking distance from major attractions, clean, takes care of every detail. The Restaurant of the hotel is really good and the food quality excellent and it is cheaper than the other restuarants in the area were you enter and you never know how much you will be paying although prices are shown at the entrance you can pay one day an amount and the next day it is doubled. Most of the people working in this hotel are really professional and very kind, always trying to help you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, pleasant staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sara786
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2008 and had a fantastic trip in Istanbul due to the location of the hotel. The rooms are great, the staff couldnt do enough to help you and i even had a turkish bath at the spa which was fantastic! :) I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, but grossly overrated”
Reviews.Author: charlesp
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well located, clean and staffed with the usual friendly and informative Turkish staff that one expects in Istanbul. Nevertheless it is not "Premier," "Regency," all "Suites" nor does it feature a "Spa" as anyone would expect a spa to be. Breakfast was cheap. One major issue that I had was that they seem to have erroneously installed industrial "Airwick" air fresheners in all of the bathrooms (see photo) which reek of faux citrus. I woke up the first morning and really felt like I had been chewing on a Febreze all night. Of course I asked housekeeping to shut it off and they said they did but actually didn't. I'm very kind to hotels in general as per my other reviews and there is nothing desperately wrong with this hotel, it's just grossly overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shanghaiasiafan
Reviews.Content: What many reviewers don't tell you and one thing I would have found interesting is that this hotel is on the same street and attached to many other small hotels. For instance Millenium hotel is right next to this hotel. There are quite a few others including another Best Western. All within a few walking steps (10 seconds) of each other. As others have mentioned, this is a perfect location. Excellent street with lots of food and the hotel is quiet with friendly people, great breakfast and the convenience cannot be beat. Our family enjoyed the stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: IDDC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and her parents stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms were very nice and clean. Hotel staff were great, very friendly and very helpful. The location is excellent for touring. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: umterp03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business back in October. Good location in Sultanahmet, right around the corner from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, quick tram ride to the Spice Bazaar. Staff was very friendly and helpful, breakfast was good and there was lots of variety. Rooms were very modern and clean and spacious. I wandered up to the rooftop terrace but it was closed for weather. Good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenGHolland
Reviews.Content: We (family of 2 adults & 2 kids) stayed in this hotel for a week in October 2011. It is a perfect location for visitng Istanbul. Within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, bus trips etc. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and made us feel very welcome. The kids were especially made a fuss of. The bedrooms were exactly as they appear on the hotel website and everywhere was spotlessly clean, particularly the bathroom. Can't praise it highly enough. The buffet breakfast was simple and enough to get us going for the day. We ate here in the evening a couple of times and there was plenty of choice and the food was good. There are many restaurants around the hotel area- we tried many as our youngest didn't want to travel too far in the evening. The hotel arranged the airport transfer without problem and also booked our trip on The Bosphorous. Pick up from the hotel and drop off if we had wanted it. I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for the perfect base for their holiday in Istanbul. It was ideal for a family group. Above all, I would like to mention the friendliness of all the staff at the hotel and thank them all for making our first trip to Istanbul enjoyable. We will certainly be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: TasmanianTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights, in October 2011, but could have stayed more. Staff so very friendly and helpful, Michael and Nescaf were always available to assist us with local information which helped our stay. Nescafe's directions to where we wanted to go was so easy to understand, we never got lost. The food was just delicious and very reasonably priced. Our room (501) was so very clean and spotless. Just sitting on our balcony watching Istanbul go by was a great way to end a busy day in Istanbul. I would recommend anyone who is coming to Istanbul to stay here. I did heaps of research to try to find the "perfect" hotel for our stay, and think I achieved it when we stayed here. You cannot go wrong if you choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vicandmichelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 2011 for 1 week, all we can say is that we were treated like we were royalty ! The front desk employees were very helpful expecially "Michael" He always had great tips on where to go and how to get there, he even helped book a few of the tours that we took and a show that we went to see. One day I wanted to call home so I bought a calling card but couldn't get it to work, after asking Michael about it he did everything and made the call for me right from the phone at the front desk ! Every morning we were treated to a great breakfast, the selection was great, a mix of the usual breakfast foods and some Turkish foods, we fell in love with "helva" so much that we have just found a store in Toronto that sells the same brand "Koska" that we had there ! We stayed in room 401 which had a balcony and faced the street, the room was small but cozy, just perfect for 2 people. We read some reviews about the street noise but even though the street outside had a "party vibe" every night we couldn't hear anything in our room ! The location was perfect, all the big attractions were within walking distance, after a couple of days we knew our way around Sultanahmet, the Grand Bazzar was about 20 minutes away but walking along the main street with the tram made if feel alot closer. There are tonnes of stores and restaurants all within walking distance of this hotel. We would like to thank the staff, especially Michael for making Istanbul one of our best vacations ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and very good value for money !”
Reviews.Author: dimitris_eirini
Reviews.Content: The most helpful and friendly staff. Breathtaking view on old town and bosphorus

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views from our balcony, central location”
Reviews.Author: CosSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2011. I literally looked at every 4 and 5 star hotel in Istanbul to figure out where we should stay for our vacation. We started on the premise that we wanted to be in Sultanahmet but realized that the only 5 star hotel in this area was the Four Seasons which I had stayed in previously and prices had tripled since the last time I stayed...We then looked at other 5 star properties but they seemd out of the way and not in the historical center. So we started looking at good 4 star and 3 star properties that were central, sound proof and had a hammam/sauna. We decided on this hotel due to its location away from the trains that run in this area and the trams that run further up, in fact the street this hotel is on is the perfect place between the tram and train tracks and we heard nothing. We were given a room on the top floor under the roof terrace, being March and cold no one was eating on the roof terrace but I read that breakfast can be served on the terrace during the summer months and this could be a real problem if you want to sleep in in the mornings. The room was a good size although there were no drawers to store clothes, just hangars. It was awkward to store your under shirts and socks etc. The bathroom was ok, standard. If you look at the photos of other members you will see that the bathroom has a window looking onto the bed area, there are blinds for privacy but I can tell you that the blinds don't really work... Our room had a great balcony with two chairs to hang out and look onto the Bosphorous, the view was amazing. If you turned away and looked in the other direction you had a view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. We walked to the two mosques, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar from our hotel. It was a treat to walk by the Blue Mosque every day. We also walked down to take the train from the train station in Sultanahmet. Our rate included breakfast and it was sufficient although it was mainly eggs, cheeses, juice and bread. It got a little bit boring towards the end. The front desk staff did not all speak good English and one lady told us that it was a 15 minute walk to a specific metro station which ended up taking us about 1hour to walk (and we walk extremely fast) so that was disconcerting. As guidebooks and tripadvisor members advise, stay in Sultanahmet and stay here if you want to avoid the noise of the trams and trains and get good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, small hotel in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tongariro
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with very friendly & helpful staff. The taxi driver had no idea where to find it, so printing out a map might be a good idea. Easy walking distance to the top tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner was perfect !”
Reviews.Author: LeapingLizz
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here, but on our last night in Istanbul we ate dinner here - we'd had a busy day and we were not very hungry but the staff welcomed us just the same - we ate on the rooftop terrace - WOW what a great view over the Bosphorus ! We ordered some Calamari and a pizza and I have to say it was the BEST meal we had in Istanbul! Not only was the meal great, but the service was fantastic ! Congratulations to the Chef (who we met on our way out) - and also to our wonderful waiter. Now I'm back in Australia I forget the names, but I think they were Guven, Cevet & Naco. Well done on superb service and a fantastic meal - next time I am in Istanbul I will know where to come for dinner on the very first night !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: AKadri
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for two days. If you really want to get great service and feel the friendly atmosphere, stay in this hotel. The guys at the reception are great and speak English perfectly. It is close. To everything in Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: abgilliam
Reviews.Content: we were thrilled with our choice of hotel instanbul. the staff were super helpful from check-in to check-out. the room was large enough for a family of 4 and extremely well cared for. the beds , including the childrens' folding chairbeds, were very comfortable. location is perfect, don't miss a drink at night on the roof terrace! service in resto was great, but food quality was nothing special. breakfast was good, and included in our rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: zoshi
Reviews.Content: Fabulous small hotel minutes walk from old quarter attractions. Quiet spacious rooms, friendly staff with great English. Sultanhmat is a tourist trap, but this is your haven. Great rooftop terrace for sea breeze and Bosphorus views, lovely street front area for people watching. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip. hotel excellent.”
Reviews.Author: julieoldcastle
Reviews.Content: Beautiful small hotel with very friendly staff who could not be more helpful. Rooms were large and very well laid out and decorated, spacious bathroom with jacuzzi bath. Food was excellent. Dinner menu had large choice and great selection of wines, all excellent. Great location within walking distance of all major sites, situated on small cobbled street with lively atmosphere. Would definitely recommend it to anyone and hope to return to it some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: IndabaYork
Reviews.Content: Our taxi driver had a bit a problem finding the hotel as the street is 'packed' with small hotels - but this was quickly resolved. The welcome was delightful and our room - rear facing requested to avoid any traffice noise - was spacious and well equipped. It is the friendliness of the staff that makes this hotel - everyone wanting to assist and please. Large choice at the buffet breakfast plus hot dishes to order. Had lunch and dinner in the open restaurant by the roadside and both meals were most enjoyable . The hotels location cannot be bettered and is just a few minutes walk from the major places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel--impeccably clean, great staff, high quality stay”
Reviews.Author: Dinnerout66
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small hotel (the title makes it sound big) on a wonderful street in Sultanahmet, restaurants, cafÃ©s, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, bazaaar all within very easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location, friendly staff - but recommend upper floors”
Reviews.Author: Farooq_11
Reviews.Content: Our overall impression of this hotel was very positive. The staff were very friendly and helpful with our requests. The rooms were clean and comfortable and quite quiet given that the location (in Sultanahmet) was quite bustling, busy and noisy; our stay coincided with ANZAC day and the area was full of Australian and New Zealand tourists who kept the bars open until quite late in the night. However, we seemed very insulated from the noise given our rooms were on the fourth floor. I would recommend asking the hotel to book floors on the upper floors. I would also mention that the hotel had free WiFi throughout the hotel which we found very useful. We booked two suite rooms in April 2011 - our first trip to Istanbul. Six of us were travelling together (a family of four with two young children aged 4 and 8 and two grandparents), so we booked two executive rooms on the fourth floor of the building. One of our rooms was a suite with a separated lounge area which was useful for sleeping the children at night. The rooms were of good quality - although one of them was quite small, and the bathrooms were clean and well decorated. Breakfast was included in our price and was good with a wide variety of foods available - especially Turkish breakfast with vegetables and cold meat cuts. Cooked eggs were available on request. However, it was really a hot cooked breakfast buffet and the breakfast eating area was quite small. We were lucky in that we arrived early for breakfast every morning (our children woke up early every morning) so we didn't have any problems getting a table. But there were one or two other families during busy days who had to split themselves up over two or three tables. The location was perfect. The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia and many other of the main tourist attractions were walking distance from the hotel. There are hundreds of places to eat near the hotel or a short walk away, and many places to shop and pick up carpets, souvenirs, pots, plates, lights, decorative items. You can also get to the Grand Bazaar quite easily within two tram stops or a short taxi ride away. The hotel staff were very helpful in guiding us around the city and especially in organising taxis from the hotel to make sure we didn't get ripped off. I would recommend this hotel to people travelling with families since the hotel has rooms that can accomodate families and there were several other families with children staying at the same time as us who all seemed happy with the accomodation. The staff were also very friendly. The only downsides were: one room was quite small although it was a 'suite' with a partitioned sitting area - and the partition was quite thin which meant that it didn't really isolate our children from the noise of the TV or our talking after putting them to sleep. The hotel was described as a four star but I would really call it a 3/4 star by European standards. In conclusion: a perfect hotel for families, great staff and very friendly, excellent location, but probably not a real '4-star' hotel. I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: lmtraveller4
Reviews.Content: 24 hours after making our internet booking, we received an e-mail from the hotel thanking us and asking if they could assist us with any arrangements during our stay in Istanbul. It was this great service that we were to see again and again during our mini vacation. We stayed (2 adults and 2 children) in a suite and although the rooms were small, they were clean and very comfortable. The hotel is ideally situated within walking distance of th Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia and there are many small outside cafes, which serve great food, along the same street. The breakfasts were good with an adequate selection of food. Even my fussy 10 year old found plenty to eat. The kitchen staff did not speak much English and my Turkish is non existent, so we did end up with some strange omelets but it was all done in such a friendly manner. After a long day of walking around the Grand Bazaar, we tried out the Turkish Bath in the basement. It was a great experience and one the children will not forget. The staff showed us what to do and then left us alone to enjoy the experience as a family, apart from the occasional pop in to make sure we were ok. Our room overlooked the street and it was great to lean out of the window and watch the street life. We did find that it was a bit noisy with the windows open though.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Courtesy”
Reviews.Author: spunge411
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this place. First of all, this is no Best Western that you would find in the States. It has all the charm of a boutique hotel with immaculate service. Upon arriving after a long flight from LA, we were offered a welcome drink, whatever we wanted! The staff is there for you hand and foot. The rooms were larger than expected, some have views and some do not, so make sure you request what you need. The beds are medium to firm. The breakfast, which is really important to start your day out was fantastic. They'll make your eggs any way you'd like, the spread was a mixture of turkish food, along with cereals, breads, meats, and cheese. If you'd ask a question they cant answer, the staff member would find a way to answer it. Customer safety and concerns are their 1st priority. The staff are also highly intelligent, you can have a conversation with them for hours on any subject. The outside patio area has heaters, and is also a good place to just soak this little piece of Old Istanbul. The location is literally 3 mins walk to the Blue Mosque, 5mins to Haigha Sophia, 7 mins to Topkapi Palace, and 7mins to the Sulanahmet station. From the terrace you can see Haigha Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Asian side. You can actually say " I can see Asia from my house!" Thank you again to All the staff!

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming hotel with excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: randn94
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here for 5 days and had a really excellent holiday. The reception area and breakfast room are both small and reminiscent of a 3 star hotel but the suite we stayed in was spacious and really excellent. The staff were superb and we could hardly have had a better time. The surrounding area close to the Topkapi Palace is vibrant with many good restaurants. There is a village atmosphere making the area safe, and friendly. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent service could not do enough to help!!”
Reviews.Author: pedwards49
Reviews.Content: Ä° have stayed in hotels all over the world and can not remember being looked after as well as Ä° have been at thÄ±s hotel. The staff are really friendly and courteous nothing was too much trouble Ä° was so relaxed Ä° stayed another 5 days! The rooms are clean and exceptionally comfortabe to accomodate my needs they gave me a executive suÄ±te which was more than enough room for one or two persons. I must also mention the staff; on reception Guven, PÄ±nar and Yuksel are aways helpful and Ä±nformative. The chef prepared me special meals, Necati, AlÄ± and PÄ±nar 2 (breakfast) always very attentive to my needs. Ä° am writiing this after spendÄ±ng the afternoon Ä±n the spa, having had a turkish bath, oÄ±l massage and 1 hours snooze!! I recommend anyone wishing to enjoy a holiday in Ä°stanbul to stay with Hasan and Ali hotel. Philip Edwards from UK. .

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place for my family (tweens)”
Reviews.Author: BJava
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am pretty picky about hotels. I've never written a review previously either. But we were so satisfied with the friendly staff (very helpful both at the hotel and when we were outside of it too!), that we had to write a review. Beyond the friendly staff, the room was beautiful and beds were comfortable. Temperature controls worked perfectly too. All the makings for a home away from home! Turkey will be seeing us again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not very good value”
Reviews.Author: bonjourahui
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights. The room we got faces another building. We are on the third floor and the other building's window is right outside of our window. The other building also blocks the sun. If you ever lived in a room with windows facing a tall wall right next to you, you would understand the feeling of imprisonment. For the time we stayed, we had such sensation of being suffocated. We later changed to a hotel with a window that looks out to the street, with the sea in the far background. When we stand in that balcony, we felt we are finally free! There is nothing wrong with this hotel, but if you get this kind of rooms (which I suspect about half are in this condition), it is very very bad. The second hotel we stayed has larger room and with a view, AND it is about 60% of the price. So value wise, this won't be my choice for sure. There's far better hotels in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, great locatÄ±on and great servÄ±ce”
Reviews.Author: csherratt001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nÄ±ghts and enjoyed oursleves very much. The hotel is on a beautÄ±ful cobbled street very close to the blue mosque and ayasofÄ±a as well as topakÄ± palace (the old one). Our room was perfectly clean and luxurÄ±ous wÄ±th polite and helpful staff and a great breakfast. We would also recommend the banana crepe from the dÄ±nÄ±ng room as well as the Safron rÄ±ce. We emailed Ä±n advance to check rates and aÄ±rport transfer and found we got the best prÄ±ce doing Ä±t thÄ±s way. (Also, brÄ±ng GBP to change Ä±n the local bureauxs as theÄ±r rates are much better than at home / the aÄ±rport). Overall, had a great holÄ±day and wÄ±ll defÄ±nately come agaÄ±n

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rkarunak
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel. Very clean and well maintained rooms. Helpful staff. Excellent location. Good breakfast buffet. Would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: four-boo
Reviews.Content: I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. It really is a little gem. It is perfectly located near all the attractions. The rooms are comfortable and well furnished, good beds and bedding and nice bathrooms. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I had asked for a quiet room, which we were provided with, but after one night we decided we would like to be at the front of the hotel. We were moved to a gorgeous room on the fourth floor with a lovely balcony overlooking the front of the hotel and the bustling street. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Only one word to describe this hotel - INCREDIBLE”
Reviews.Author: hannamzatzs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my wife and 2 girls ages 7 and 11. We have traveled to many places in the world, and stayed in many large 5-star hotels, and we feel that this was one of the top hotels we have every had the pleasure to stay in. Our room was huge and beautiful with the dark hardwood, and wonderful amenities. And the staff - to say we felt like family would be an understatement. Our room was not ready on arrival so we were treated to a free drink on the front patio while we waited. When we were going to a local restaurant and the restaurant's shuttle didn't show up to pick us up, the manager got on the phone and told the restaurant how disappointed he was and how he wanted them to come immediately to get us. We felt the entire time like the staff were really looking out for us, and our happiness was the most important thing in the world to them. And you couldn't ask for a much better location - 5 minutes to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and lots of great restaurants. What a great small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in the historic Sultanahmet area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FrequentPoipuVisitor
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel location for seeing the grand mosques, Topkapi, the ancient cistern and other famous sights. The neighborhood is charming but it is the tourist area, so if that bothers you look further. Wonderful accommodating staff, very good breakfast buffet, good, but not great food in their restaurant. Our quiet room had a panoramic view of the Bosporus, however the weird TV setup in our room never worked. No worries we were on holiday anyway. The hotel has a convenient sidewalk cafe for evening drinks and great people watching. The front desk could not have been more helpful. And although the servers were prompt and friendly, a few disparately needed a shower and industrial strength deodorant. I could not even consider arranging a Turkish bath or massage from a host who stank to high heavens! Most of the neighborhood restaurants serving typical Turkish food were very good and reasonable for a main tourist area. For seafood, despite other negative reviews, the nearby BALIKCI SABAHATTIN with its wonderful outdoor terrace was not inexpensive yet it served great seafood with wonderful variety and mostly it was locals who were eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Service, What a Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: cbt767
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice in the last year. There is nowhere else I would even consider. Right in the heart of it all, and the staff is very helpful. I have never been treated nicer by any hotel I have been to in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location, friendly service, great room and breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: McGLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel in the middle of Old Town. Highly recommended. Very friendly and helpful staff. Worth the little extra it costs.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MMaryP
Reviews.Content: Don't know why the advertised room price is so high on trip advisor?! I stayed at this hotel with my mother as we came to Istanbul to visit my sister and her husband who are on a motorbike tour trip. Unfortunately my sister had an accident (a crazy taxi drove into her) so we were there to cheer her up while she recovered. The hotel was down the road from their hostel so we were able to add some luxury to their lives for a few days. The staff here were so welcoming and friendly we immediately felt at home. After (all four of us) dining in their restaurant on the first night we decided to come back for our second night as didn't want to risk another place not being so nice. We dined on the roof terrace (not to be missed - great atmosphere and wonderful views). The hotel is quite small which gives it that personal touch, the main thing which made it stand out were the great staff here. Especially (I think his name was) Al - thanks for looking after us so well!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem.”
Reviews.Author: mandyjo63
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel was a complete delight - from our very early check in - arrived from an overnight flight at 6.30am and were offered a shower, breakfast and baggage storage while our room was being readied. The location in superb - walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Palace, Grand Bazaar and to many lovely little restaurants. The room was well appointed and the hotel charming. What really stands out though was the wonderful attitude and helpfulness of the staff. They made us feel so welcome. On reading the visitors book I realised that this was not just our experience but everyone else's as well. I highly recommend this hotel - it was a real find in a big city with many hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the center of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BabyBearNewYork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 10-day trip to Turkey, and stayed at some wonderful hotels everywhere. But the best hotel for us was the Best Western Premier Regency Suites, and that's high praise since we really enjoyed the other hotels we stayed at. We stayed here for 4 nights. The location is fabulous - it's on Akbiyik Caddesi, which is a street full of cafes, lovely restaurants offering street-side tables in summer, and boutique hotels. It's a five minute walk to Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque, seven minutes to the Topkapi Saray, and just round the corner from the Arasta Bazar, which is a smaller, less frenzied, and less confusing version of the Grand Bazar, and no pressure from any of the shopkeepers. The waterfront is five minutes away by cab, and Taksim about 20 minutes away. The hotel is small - 16 rooms - but has all the conveniences you would expect, like an elevator, ground floor restaurant serving meals all day long, and even its own hammam and spa! The rooms are great - we had three rooms (401, 403 and 404) on the fourth floor - and are huge, particularly by Istanbul standards. The fittings and furnishings are of very high quality - super comfortable beds, sofas and sitting area, two desks, LCD TV mounted on the wall, room safe, minibar, etc. Perfect to come home to after a long day's sightseeing! Free wi-fi was a bonus, also there is a laptop guests can use, plus a printer downstairs. There's a beautiful rooftop on the fifth floor with views of the Marmara Sea on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other. By the way, some other reviewers had commented on the noise from the call to prayer. Our rooms faced the street, and we had no noise issues at all - the windows are double glazed, and the most we heard was a light murmur one night. Considering it's such a lively street, it was amazingly quiet. The hotel staff was so kind and caring - any requests we had were attended to promptly. The girl at the front desk even told us not to exchange money at the hotel as we could get a better rate outside! Whenever we took a taxi, they would come outside and give the address to the driver in Turkish, and one time when we were taking a cab back to the hotel and the driver was trying to overcharge us when we reached, she actually came outside and yelled at him, and voila! that was the end of his overcharging attempts! Breakfast every day was very good - huge selection of fruits, yogurt, cheeses and eggs cooked to order. Overall, we felt it was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at, and can highly recommend it. We are planning to return to Turkey next year, and will stay here again for sure. For large, well appointed rooms, personalized service and great location, you can't do any better!

Reviews.Title: “Care and effort makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: Urbstudy
Reviews.Content: Everyone talks about how wonderful Istanbul is, but the most wonderful suprise is how friendly and helpful the people are -- no more so than the Best Western Regency Suites in Sultanhamet. Beyond the well decorated rooms and public spaces (all fastidiously tidy), the staff couldn't have done more to try and make things as accessible as possible for my mother who walks with a cane. While I love a big, deep bath tub/shower such was difficult for my mother to use given her limited range of mobility (the baths do have wall handles, but anyone who has mobility issues would still likely need help getting in an out of the tub). The hotel staff quickly went to work reconfiguring the tub/shower, and also looked after her at the hotel spa/Turkish bath as if she was a grand Ottoman dowager. In a lively neighborhood better known for hostels and basic hotels, the intimate Regency Suites stands out as a small jewel of a hotel where the staff is warm and friendly and genuinely want to do as much as possible for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - ideal location and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: gillhopie
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 days in Istanbul and have had an amazing time which has been enhanced by our stay at the Best Western. The staff were courteous, helpful and very pleasant. The hotel was spotless and the room we had was comfortable with all the amenities you would need. We had sole use of the sauna and turkish bath which was free and extremely relaxing. Breakfast was good - different types of tea/meats/cheeses and pastries plus lots of fresh fruit and eggs cooked to order. We had an excellent evening meal on the sunroof restaurant which had breathtaking views of the Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia. The hotel is in an ideal situation with easy access to the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Marmara seafront etc. We came to Istanbul so we could experience a different culture and was quite disappointed when we weren't woken up by the call to prayer ! Some of the other hotels around may be grander and bigger but they would have to go a long way to compete with the memorable experience this hotel has given us.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Cramped but with Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: iloveluxuryholidays
Reviews.Content: Exactly as the title, this hotel was very over priced for what it was. The staff were lovely but you literally could not swing a cat in this hotel it was one of the most cramped places I have ever stayed at. The hotels pictures are thoroughly mis leading, imagine a very narrow tiny house, that what this hotel is. everything is cramped and squashed from the moment you get in. I left in the end and stayed at the 4 seasons, which although is double the price, you get some breathing space. Location of this hotel wasnt bad, very close to all the main attractions in Sultanahmet, and the staff were very nice. In terms of the food, it was awful, at breakfast the juice was all from diluted concentrates, and there was a very limited range of food. Lots of the food I had for some reason had hairs in it. There was no ambience for the price you paid, it was just all squashed up cramped living, at breakfast every time someone moved their chair would grind against the floor and make the worst noises. I would not ever expect to pay this kind of money for a hotel like this again...

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: phototropic99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our recent Honeymoon in Istanbul. The hotel is in an excellent location for all the major sights, 5 mins walk from the Topkapi Palace and 10 mins from the Blue Mosque. The street outside is good for bars and restaurants as is the surrounding area. The room was nicely furnished and had a quality feel, the bathroom is great and had a sauna bath and oddly features a window (with blind) between the bathroom and the room. Our room had a balcony but was a bit smaller than the others. The room was generally clean although the hot water had a brownish tinge and my wife claimed there was dust in the corners of the room and under the bed. I didnt notice. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was quiet given that it faced onto the street outside which has quite a few late night (but tasteful) bars. The staff were attentive and the service was very good. The breakfast was reasonable and featured a buffet and you could order eggs/omelette. The only downside on the staff was we reserved the turkish bath exclusively apparently but when we went down there were other people about, not sure how they implement this. I would definately recommend the hotel but it is quite pricey. We got a deal online with ~25% off which helped. Probably worth it for the location and quiet rooms as the calls to prayer first thing in the morning can be quite loud. Note that whilst the location (Sultanahmet) is good it is extremely difficult to get there from Sabiha Gokcen airport due to the traffic (budget 2-3 hours drive). If you are flying to attaturk it is probably more convienient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BowE3London
Reviews.Content: We spent the second half of our week in Istanbul in this hotel. Much better than the first (Richmod Hotel - Iskitlal Cad) and in a great location enabling us easy access to all parts of Istanbul of interest - including over the Golden Horn in Beyoglu and Galatasaray (by tram). Room was large and well appointed and staff very friendly - particularly with our young daughter (4 yo). Lots of places to eat and drink nearby - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hosts and the Best Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KBontje
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the best location on a quaint cobblestone street surrounded by cafes and shops!!! All the local attractions are a very short walk and the people are more than friendly!!! The Hotel is small and personable and they do everything to make your stay pleasant. The rooms are large and very comfortable :) ENJOY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff in a Top Location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWoottonBassett
Reviews.Content: Our first experience on arriving was being met by really friendly and helpful staff who offered us a cup of Turkish tea or coffee -- this excellent service continued throughout our stay. The hotel is immaculate and well maintained. Having exclusive use of Turkish Hamam was wonderful. The hotel is in a superb location, right between the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace, with views from the roof terrace across the Sea of Marmara. It was quite early in the season, with somewhat chilly evenings, but the staff were more than happy to accommodate us on the roof terrace restaurant with good food and warm blankets!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: shargs
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor website reviews (I've never done that before). Certainly wasn't disappointed. The hotel is in a great location - walking distance to all the Old town sights. Very helpful and friendly staff. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “overall very good value”
Reviews.Author: panos_p
Reviews.Content: HAving read various reviews we had set the bar high. Overall, the hotel passed the test. On the positive side: Very spacious rooms, with all the amenities that give a touch of luxury, with flat screen, satellite tv's and wooden floors, really nice bathrooms, which add to the upscale feeling. Very clean property, the best location possible for people that want to go sightseeing, close to public transportation (which we found very convenient). The staff was really friendly, although most people do not understand or speak good English. Still that was not a problem, as there was another staff member that did. Price was really good, if you compare against likes. Nice touch: free use of really fast internet from a laptop next to the reception. I think there was free wifi in the rooms, too, but did not need it and am not sure. On the less positive side: this street can sometimes be very noisy. On Saturday evening between 9:30 and 11:30 there was a lot of noise coming from the street. We had our windows open but even when we closed them we could easily hear the noise. On the same evening, there was a 30min disturbence from the lobby of the hotel from people that had gathered there and were just speaking loud (no yelling), which for us being on the first floor could be heard as if the noise were coming just outside of our room door. This never happened again and may be it is not so often as the hotel is really small with only a handful of rooms. Speaking about size, the breakfast area was really small without this being necessarily a problem, but it is not suitable for people that lfancy taking breakfast in 1-1/2 hrs in order to relax. Last 2 things that I really found annoying: 1. The satellite english speaking channels (and at least half of the others) never worked while we were there. Despite the fact the staff tried to correct the problem (they changed sat receiver) the problem persisted. The excuse (and the message on ther screen) was there was no signal. At the same time, though, every morning at the break fast area BBC was playing spotlessly! When I asked, they told me it was a different satellite receiver from the one for the rooms! This till does not explain why there was no signal (as they claimed). 2. We asked the staff a few times about tips for eating out. Their only recommendations were those for which they apprently receive retrocessions - they would routinely pull a brochure from the stand on the reception desk and insist that was a very good choice. When we asked for a recommendation in the surrounding area of Sultanahmet during the first day (as we were too tired to walk for long) their only tip was the restaurant Best Western Acropol just scross the street! Mind you, there are probably 25-30 restaurants we counted during our stay in a radius of just 200-300 m away and at least 5 up to 50 (yes, fifty) meters from our hotel. Overall: Do go to this hotel, it is really a nice property especially for those that dislike the big properties. Just keep in mind to check about sat tv and don't ask the hotel staff for dining tips, who otherwise (don't get me wrong) were really polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FromAuw
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has a great location. It is within a walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi and the tram line/taxi stops that will take you to the other attractions in Istanbul. It is surrounded by a great diversity of restaurants (the negative being that you will be asked to check the menus as you walk the streets) and small shops. A very lively and colorful neighbourhood. Not too noisy at night though. There is a restaurant at the roof terrace with nice views, however it did not seem to be very popular. Very friendly staff, a good example of what you will find in Turkey. Breakfast was fair and adequate. The hotel was very clean. The only downside is that one of our rooms (on the ground floor at the back left of the entrance) was ridiculously small for two people. After complaining, a larger room was made available two nights later, but no refunds. That was a single room for sure. I recommend this hotel because of the location, specially if you are interested to stay in the old town. However make sure you book a room in the first or second floors.

Reviews.Title: “It was exactly as we wanted it”
Reviews.Author: KalR
Reviews.Content: Many thanks go out to Mike and Mustafa for making our stay beautiful. They attended to the smallest details, including our baby girl's needs. I appreciate all that staff have done for us, and it was my pleasure getting to meet them all. God Bless, K

Reviews.Title: “A home way away from home!”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaSpain
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a visit to Istanbul! Location could not be better right in the center of Sultanahmet--two minute walk to AyaSofia and the Blue Mosque. The size is perfect with only 16 units it allows for personal care by the staff who are all super friendly and helpful. All the units are very comfortable providing for very good sleep, and of course very clean. We particularly like the heated bathroom floors! Very nice restaurant too--great breakfast with lots of choices. We needed to keep exercising and it offers a very nice gym with modern machines that you can access at any time. We also had some work to do and the staff could not have been more helpful adjusting to our needs of working US hours, printing, coffee to saty away. We stayed here for two weeks ... we missed them!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, pricey but ideally located for the main sites”
Reviews.Author: Born-in-NW3
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, but with the standards of a luxury chain. The rooms were well fitted and clean. The staff were super polite and keen to help. Everything was of perfectly good quality for discerning Europeans or Americans. Breakfast lacked fresh juice, otherwise it was good. The hotel is in a quiet (traffic wise) but centrally located area, with lots of restaurants around (but do not eat at the Korean one over the road!). Easy to walk to the main tourist sites or get the tram to Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. Did not use the spa, looked very good, but massages were overpriced. However the sauna and gym are free. Rooms are not cheap but you won't wish you had gone somewhere else, which is always a risk otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Red_to_the_bone
Reviews.Content: What a little gem of a hotel for tourists. Excellent location (10 mins walk to most of the key sites), really good facilities and top class service from every member of staff we dealt with. Only one word of warning - 'deluxe suite' rather over-states it by anyone used to American hotels - deluxe room would be a very fair description, though. Extremely quiet (unlike many hotels in the same area), very comfortable, well equipped and beqautifully maintained. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: zeberdeeHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights at this hotel and would hightly recommend it for service, comfort and proximity. The staff we very helpful and friendly, food was excellent and we had a very attractive comfortable large room . The turkish bath was luxurious after a days' sightseeing. This hotel is really a stone's throw from all the main sightseeing attractions.I cannot fault this hotel for anything and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the middle of the most famous sights”
Reviews.Author: sukeyAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel entirely by chance and from the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome in an unobtrusive and very friendly way. The Best Western name meant that we were not expecting a family run hotel. Our rooms were exactly as described and very comfortable. The whole place was spotless and nothing was too much trouble. Mustafa and his colleagues at the front desk were a fount of knowledge about their city and organised us with maps, tours, transport and directions. Alper and his colleagues in the Restaurant/Bar were equally friendly and helpful. You definitely got the impression that this hotel is staffed by a team who work well together and get on well together. It is perhaps not for the budget concious but was worth every penny to us as we fell into bed exhausted every night after sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Istanbul amazing!”
Reviews.Author: cleanclothes
Reviews.Content: My (now) fiancee and I traveled to Istanbul during the middle of January of 2010 and I have to say that the staff and management of this hotel went out of their way to make our trip unforgettable. They were helpful and accommodating at every turn. The gentleman at the front desk could tell we were young "love birds" and took it upon himself to upgrade us to the largest room while keeping us at the same rate! When they found out that I had proposed the night before, the management sent us a complimentary fruit basket and even tried to give us free drinks in the bar! The location of the Hotel is convenient to all of the major sights. Even in the cold rain, we were still only a short 3 minute walk to the Ayasofia and Blue Mosque. If we ever find ourselves in Istanbul again, we will definitely stay with our friends at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just like a dream”
Reviews.Author: Sebfromnowhere
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay in Istanbul, sure because the city is full of history and beautiful, because the food is nice and the people welcoming but also and mainly thanks to the Best Western Premier Regency Suites & Spa Hotel !! The rooms are great and the staff is wonderful ! We could even make friend and get every day very useful advise for our 10 day stay. I don't even mention the sauna / hammam that you can book privately (oh Internet is also included). And the restaurant around (and the one of the hotel, thanks for these delicious breakfast) are perfect. I said I would recommend it strongly to my friends and I will ! Enjoy your stay and please say hi to everyone from us ;) ! Tonya & Seb

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and great location”
Reviews.Author: ritaright
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 12/31 to 1/8. When I arrived on New Year's Eve, they had overbooked, so they had to put me up at one of their other hotels down the street. Of course, I was not happy about that, BUT, they did make it up to me by upgrading us to the honeymoon suite for the rest of our stay. The room was wonderful, it had a great view of the Bosphores, a nice terrace to have breakfast on, and a jaccuzi big enough for two! In fact, it looked just like the photos online. The staff were all wonderful, spoke good English, and were very eager to help with anything we needed (even a luggage scale and a PC card reader!). The breakfast was good, but after 7 days does get repetitive. The Turkish bath was clean and available and right next to their adequate fittness center. The rooms had everything we needed such as in room safe, tea maker, hair dryer, etc, and it was quiet. The location was perfect. We could walk to all the famous attractions like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topeka Palace, etc. Overall, I would say this was one of the best hotels in the area. If I come to Istanbul again, I surely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Meriharakka
Reviews.Content: Liked to location, near Bule Mosque and Hagia Sofia - and on a nice street with restaurants and small shops. Still a quiet street. Big room, everything working. Stuff really helpful and friendly. Free wireless, worked all the time w/o any hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Luxurious and Friendly Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Tessara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week and I must say I have enjoyed the maximum of it! It has a very nice architecture and a modern design. The hotel is situated in a relatively quiet and clean area, so you will definetely enjoy the fresh air. Its location is close to some of the most important points of attraction from Istanbul, so you will not have any trouble keeping yourself busy visiting them. The rooms are cozy, clean and well-equipped, you can even serve yourself with a cup of tea or coffee. I have stayed on the 1st floor, so my room also had a small terrace/balcony/garden, which made my stay even more pleasant. The food served at breakfast was delicious and with a great variety of choices. The staff from the reception was extremely friendly and helpful and spoke good English. This hotel is ABSOLUTE HEAVEN and in case some of you decide to stay in it, I hope you will enjoy it as much as I have!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for your hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Londonerinnit
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel within walking distance of the Topkapi museum, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Rooms were spacious, clean and well-decorated. Staff were very polite and helpful. Breakfast buffet could have been a bit more varied, but there was still a fair amount to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Akafay
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this little gem. The room was elegant, the staff gracious and accommodating, and the location was perfect for seeing the sights. A full breakfast was included, and many restaurants nearby of evening dining. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but some warnings about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: ramses2nd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regency Suites for 4 nights over the Eid holiday in September with 2 young children. The hotel staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful. The room was spottlesly clean and had extra beds for both our children and the location is perfect for visiting the main sights of Istanbul. However, a couple of warnings. First, a suite in Turkey doesn't mean multiple rooms, merely a single bedroom with ensuite bathroom. Secondly, the deluxe suites (I don't think they have a standard class, the alternative is an executive suite) offer a view of a brick wall just over a metre from the windows. Not that we were there to sit looking out the window, but you couldn't even tell if it was cloudy or sunny without craning your neck out the window. Warning's out the way, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the hotel - just be aware what you're booking.

Reviews.Title: “Could have not been better....”
Reviews.Author: NicholasA
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Turkey was made especially memorable by our stay at the Regency Suites Hotel. The friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff made it very special. It was difficult saying goodbye. We intend to return next year and see everyone again...

Reviews.Title: “Incredible people and location”
Reviews.Author: Rohit G
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after extensive research on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. The location is marvellous, just behind the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace - clearly Sultanahment is the place to stay if you intend to do 'cultural / historical Istanbul'. And public transport is excellent so you can quite easily get to 'hip / tendy Istanbul'. More on the hotel - just 16 rooms meant room service was super quick. We had our 2 year old daughter in tow and staff were always very helpful - warm milk at any time was delivered with a smile! Breakfast was basic but good and the chef will make eggs on request. Found the turkish pastries cold and the juice diluted, though. The restaurant has an extensive menu, although we didn't really eat there, except for pasta for our daughter, which was nicely done. Rooms were relatively spacious by European standards. We were upgraded to an Executive Suite (with jacuzzi) 404 and although ours was marginally smaller than some of the others, this was more than made up by the street view (as opposed to the ones at the rear which looked out onto someone's washing line). The street - Akbiyik Cadessi is full of and eclectic mix of small hotels, hostels, restaurants and bars and has a festive atmosphere at most times - we went over the Eid break so it was even more vibrant! Even if you book using the BW website, do call and ask the hotel directly for discounts - we got 10% off for paying cash. All in all, a great place, and our thanks to the wonderful staff for making our stay really special and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM...”
Reviews.Author: victorwhiteboord
Reviews.Content: Before choosing to stay at the BW Premier Regency Suites I read lot of reviews on tripadvisor. And it was the best place I stayed at during my two weeks traveling around Istanbul... The rooms are modestly appointed but have most everything you might need.Amazing breakfast,clean hotel,comfortable bed and excellent service.We got there at 6 am and they let us check in to our room before the regular check in time. We will definitely recommend our friends.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the Regency Premier Suites”
Reviews.Author: colgalEnglewoodCo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Regency Premier Suites for 2 nights and had a wonderful experience. We made arrangements for the hotel to have a driver available at the airport and he was waiting for us as we departed the terminal. We were greeted by Alex who explained all of the hotel's facilities and offered information on private tours, etc. We had a smallish room on the top floor with a very large, amazing balcony that overlooked the blue mosque which was spectacular at night. The rrom was air conditioned and very clean and the bath had a jacuzzi tub. The rate included breakfast which was very substantial-a typical Ottoman buffet with meats, cheeses, fruit and vegetables in addition to an American breakfast with cooked to order eggs, omelettes, juice, coffee and pastries. We loved the location-an easy walk from all the sights and on a quaint street that had numerous restaurants. We had dinner on the rooftop terrace the night we arrived and had it all to ourselves. The food and service were wonderful and we were disappointed when it rained the next evening. Our room was directly under the rooftop terrace and had a beautiful view and there was even another terrace for relaxing right outside our door. Everyone at the hotel was warm and friendly and willing to do anything to make the stay most comfortable-they even gave us umbrellas to use when it rained! A lovely intimate hotel with a fantastic staff-everything we wanted!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel - great accommodations, fitness center, staff, and location!”
Reviews.Author: p2ej
Reviews.Content: This place was fabulous. It had absolutely everything we needed. My husband, daughter (20), son (19) and myself spent three nights in Istanbul. This place was perfect for so many reasons. The main reason we stayed here was because they had a fitness center, which is very difficult to find in the boutique hotels in Istanbul. The fitness center was perfect; small but very clean and had everything we needed! The hotel was fabulous for other reasons as well. The street it is located on is beautiful, very quaint, and located near many points of interest. The accommodations were great: we had the two rooms on the first floor and each of those rooms had adorable courtyards that were delightful to sit on with a glass of wine prior to dinner or great for a cup of coffee early in the morning. The rooms were wonderful as well! The staff was the best; so pleasant, accommodating and a wealth of information. Breakfast was delicious as well! We did eat at the restaurant on top of the hotel and again everything was great â€“ a beautiful view and delicious food. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. We had a fabulous time and much of that had to do with our stay at The Best Western Premier Regency Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find...friendly staff, great facilities and location...will go back.”
Reviews.Author: hk10140
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a boutique feel without the price. Everything about the venue was wonderful - clean rooms, good breakfast and helpful staff. Location, location, location - we were close enough to most landmarks on foot (even with a 7 year old in tow!). Would recommend this to families and couples alike.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: eggpod
Reviews.Content: Wow! This hotel has all the amenities and luxuries of a 5 star hotel for 3/4 of the price. The rooms are impeccably clean and big; the staff is lovely--friendly and happy; the hotel is waling distance to all the major sites; the breakfast, which is included in the price, is a small feast. They serve everything from fresh fruits, eggs, different breads and muffins, meat, traditional pastries, different juices, coffee and tea. The rooftop restaurant has good food and a breathtaking view of the bosphorous--500 yards to your right is the blue mosque and to your left is agia sophia. With all this, you all have a private traditional turkish hamam downstairs, which you can use anytime during your stay. We loved this place, and we are planning to go back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rmoore0847
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be an excellent choice. The location, the old town area, is perfect for walking to most of the best sights. The staff was knowledgable, helpful and very pleasant. Their recommendations of restaurants was excellent - none of them was on the street where the hotel is located. We did eat on the hotel rooftop the last night. The food was well prepared and the evening view very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: joknecht
Reviews.Content: My wife booked the hotel after checking its Trip Advisor review. We were coming into Istanbul after a 12 night luxury cruise of the Greek Islands, so we weren't expecting anything more than a decent room. Boy were we wrong, this hotel was fantastic! It's small (only 16 rooms) and so beautifully situated that we never needed a taxi or even public transportation to get to "everything" in Istanbul. The staff was simply excellent, especially the young lady at the front desk who gave me her name, but I lost it before writing this review. Everything was "no problem". We arrived early in the morning knowing that our room would not be available, yet they hurried to get the room ready and we were able to occupy it way before the check-in time. When the computer in the lobby (a laptop) was unable to access our email service, they arranged for us to go across the street to another hotel and we were not charged anything by the other hotel, even though they charged their own clients. Breakfasts were included in our room rate and they were excellent, a wide range of cheese, meats, olives and fruit. In addition, eggs were available any way you wanted them. The room itself was spotless, quiet and comfortable. (and relatively large by European standards). Three caveats: First, a building two doors away is still undergoing reconstruction, and some construction noise was noticed, but it wasn't intrusive or too early in the morning. Second, the hotel is in a great section of Istanbul that contains a number of backpacker hostels. We loved it, being surrounded by young people from all over the world in the inexpensive bars and restaurants that dot the street, but it might not be to everyone's liking. Third, our taxi driver had trouble finding it even though we had the address and a map location, you may want to do the same before going there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: nibushi
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a five day break in Istanbul. The Best Western Premier Regency Suites and Spa is fabulously located beside the Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque. We arrived at midnight but the desk staff were very welcoming and our room was ready. Our initial fears about having a street view were unfounded as our executive suite room was clean and spacious. The buffet breakfast is really healthy, which makes a change, and we ate at breakfast tables set out on the street. Every member of staff was courteous and offered every assistance. The meals on the roof terrace are delightful and, with views of the Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque and Bosphorus, this makes for a pretty spectacular setting! A gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully unexpected!”
Reviews.Author: jdcCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We never stay in Best Westerns, but this was the only hotel we could find in the area we wanted to stay. The experience could not have been better! The staff was so helpful and kind--including the kitchen staff that would prepare fantastic breakfasts as well as dinners. The room was spotless and quiet. The location is perfect as you can walk to many tourist sites. The area around the hotel is safe and there are many restaurants in walking distance (try the restaurant next to the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel, friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler20171
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in June 2009. After a long flight to Istanbul, we were extremely tired. When we arrived at the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel. It was very clean and and luxurious. Bathroom was large. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommended this hotel to any one looking for a 4 to 5 star accommodation at a reasonable price. The location is very close all old town attractions.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: angler_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in mid June for 5 nights which was arranged by my wife as a surprise birthday present.The staff presented me with a birthday cake and wine and fruit in our room.Totally unexpected, and really appreciated.the Hotel itself was excellent, and the room was 1st class.the decor was elegant , modern and extremely clean. The staff ,especially the manager, were very courteous and friendly and I would recommend the hotel for its location and general ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, superb, A class, *********”
Reviews.Author: kaytata
Reviews.Content: stayed here for four nights, 27th-31st july. THE STAFF: couldnt be more helpful and courteous. a huge thank you to the cleaning girls who remembered our names! the sweet receptionist who had smiles and information for us every morning and of course Ali and Negaite. THE LOCATION: excellant, away from the hussle and bustle, whilst also only 5mins walk from literally everything in sultanahmet! we even walked to galata bridge/tower in only 25mins following the tramline. the road its on is a modern road where loads of tourists stay. we were out late night and felt quite safe even in twos. THE ROOMS: our room was a little smaller that the others' that we were travelling with, and cost us quite abit more as there were three in ours and four in the other. but rooms were clean, sufficient and gave us a great sleep. tv was a little hard to work out, but everything was great and really enjoyed our stay. THE FOOD AT THE HOTEL: breakfast was a rather small choice, but their chocolate cake was too die for! ali is a great cook and i would have recommended eating all meals at their restaurant if it werent a good experience to eat out. we ate better at the hotel restaurant than anywhere else, and they even let us take our own drinks. THE VIEW: our room window was about 2metres from another building, so we didnt get a nice view, they were doing some work in that building, but i was never disturbed by noise or anything. the call to prayer was beautiful, i would have loved to be able to hear it in our room, but never heard it. the view of the sea from the terrace upstairs was beautiful, they let me sit out there everyday just reading my book and didnt feel forced to order food! they even provided blankets when it was cold. the only thing i found lacking was that the gym was rather small and we didnt get a massage as planned as it was quite alot more expensive than in our local here. apart from that ten out of ten. many thanks from Kobita, Amina and Taneiya

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Recommended”
Reviews.Author: angelaboltons
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine , well equipped and clean. also has a very kind stuff.. The accommodation felt safe, relatively quiet .. Location is very central in old Sultanahmet and the view from the terrace magnificent.. Thanks to everyone for kind services.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Mia
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with my family between 12th July and 17 July 2009. We had a pleasent stay. The staff were excellent, especially Emin, all rounder working during his university holidays, Ali the waiter and the gentleman on reception at night who wears glasses, His name starts with M I think ??????? Sorry mate can't remember the name. We had an early flight and he went out of his way to give us cooked breakfast as the chef had not arrived. By this I mean, he was in the process of cooking it. We appreciated this gesture, but opted for cereals instead. Nothing to complain a great hotel and the staff make it greater. Would definitly go back. oh and its got freeeeeeeeeee high speed WiFi in the roomsso take your laptops.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Donnah96
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Regency Suites is a very friendly hotel located near Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. The rooms are spotless, the location is central and the staff wants to be sure that its guests love Turkey. I felt the staff was genuinely concerned about my well-being and security. I travel often but the helpfulness and care offered by the Regency Suites' staff stands out from other hotels I have stayed at. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: beyondboston718
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay in Istanbul at the Regency Premier! The staff was extremely knowlegable and helpful. The hotel was very close to prominent landmarks of Istanbul (e.g. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia) and close to a tram stop which we used to travel around the city. It is on a lively street in Sultanahmet with plenty of fun restaurants and shops surrounding it. As a family of 4, we got two wonderful adjoining rooms which were clean and well furnished. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everybody! (BTW-we booked this hotel as part of a package, so we don't know it's exact value.)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the center of the old town”
Reviews.Author: ce1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week and we're satisfied with the staff and the hotel. Located close to the tourist attrations and 15-20 min by taxi to the shopping streets and malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: njG-man
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to all the important attractions in the Sultanahmet area in a nice and quiet hotel, this is it. The hotel was quiet - we had room 302 in the back and did not even hear the prayer calls a couple times. The rooms are well appointed and roomy, and the spa facilities (including a hammam) are very nice. The breakfast was very good â€“ they made eggs to order and brought coffee etc. to the outside table. The staff was very courteous, helpful and made us feel like we were the only ones there. They recommended Hamdi restaurant which turned out to be very good with a nice view of the Galata bridge area. The roof top terrace (no cover) has an excellent view of the tops of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque as well as the Marmara Sea. A very nice place to have a late dinner and see the domes all lit up. The Fez travel agency, conveniently located down the street, arranged for private, guided tour. And since the location is so close to all the main attractions, there no need for bus ride pick-up and time spent riding around. When I return to Istanbul, I will stay here. Again, trip advisor came through.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Manager was a typical Turk - Very Hospitable!”
Reviews.Author: eyes_n_ears
Reviews.Content: When I asked the Hotel Manager if we could borrow a UK/continental adapter he said yes and looked for one but could not find it - so they bought us one! Everything we needed was provided by the friendly and kind staff. The restaurant was particularly good, with a wide selection of excellent food, we ate at least 5 times here in the three days we stayed in Sultanahmet. We were even invited to choose from food not on the menu. The Turks are well known for their hospitality and the staff at this hotel typified that wonderful tradition. I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone staying near the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardqx4
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect in our trip. We love Istanbul and happy to stay in this Great Boutique Hotel.. hotel is in the middle of the historical sultanahmet and away from Hagia Sophia with a walking distance. With great situation, this hotel has great service and great room... Thanks to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Hass77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, but very good. Great service, great room - we had room on the top floor which gave us a view of the river, and looking back, you could just about see the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The room was good & my wife loved the spa. The only downside was the breakfast - not great, but not too bad either. The location of the hotel is fantastic. 5-10 minutes walk from a lot of the main tourist attractions. The street itself has a lot of decent places to eat or to relax and smoke sheesha!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Suite Hotel - A Very Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: JXBR
Reviews.Content: A hotel suite is normally means a connected series of rooms to be used together and not a single room as was provided. I booked what was described as Suite Executive Room and expected what I would normally get from a suite: a separate bedroom and other living area. I wanted a larger room because I was staying 8 days. I got s single room - clearly not a suite - at what was really an outrageous price. This really is misleading advertising and not acceptable. The street where the hotel is located has many other hotels and hostels as well as bars and restaurants. It is fairly downmarket with any walk down the street resulting in being accosted by touts for each. The hotel has a basic restaurant serving uninspiring food. The breakfast buffet is limited and poor. There is a very small range of breakfast cereals and fruit and some poor cold meat products that are really only suitable for feeding to the many cats in the area. There is a top floor open-air balcony but, unlike other hotels, this has no awnings or canopies and so is quite unusable in the hot afternoons. There is a separate smaller balcony area off the fourth floor but this is unfinished. There was building work and associated noise that went on until around 8:00 pm some days but this was not mentioned anywhere on the hotelâ€™s Web site. And on a final note; rooms were typically not made-up until after 4;00 pm. When we arrived back one day after 4:00 pm we were told our room was not cleaned and were offered a drink while we waited. These drinks appeared on our bill at check-out. I have to say that my experience with this hotel is so completely at odds with that of others that I feel something is fundamentally wrong. I selected the hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews and, based on this experience, have a significantly reduced trust in reviews on this site. The very poor value for money and overall experience invalidates any minor saving graces such as cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: arebeeSydney
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of being guests at the Best Western Premier Regency Suites, Sultanahmmet, Istanbul during May 2009. We had been on Seabourn Spirit for three weeks and were absolutely spoiled. The pampering continued at the Best Western Premier Regency Suites for a further four days. The rooms were spacious and clean, the service from the staff at all levels were beyond reproach. We felt immediatly at home. When we were checking out., the porter was attending to our luggage whilst three staff members, including the receptionist and the dining room manager together with a third staff member waved us farewell from the steps of the front door. There are apparently fifteen Best Western Hotels in the vicinity. Make sure the cab driver "drops you off at" Best Western Premier Regency Suites Akbryik Cad.No 38 Sultanahmet.
