It is situated in the middle of the tourist district within walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace. The Open Bazaar, The Cistern and many other exciting places. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great trip enhanced by a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hamtron
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good. Clean with very friendly staff. The room was a good size and was very clean. The location is great, just a few minutes walk to the Hagia Sophia and the Blue mosque. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting The Sites”
Reviews.Author: oalani1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 days and they, starting from the front desk, Mustapha, were all great in every detail. Helpful at all times in all our needs. They even managed to put us in our room as we arrived at 8 am, and they extended their hospitality further with smiles and Breakfast. If you want to visit the historic sites, then this place is just a walk away from all, the sole problem is the building next door that is being redone, so bare the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious spa hotel at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Shumailla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Regency Suites & Spa in April this year. We were looking for a spa hotel at a reasonable cost and that's exactly what we got. As soon as we entered the hotel we were welcomed by professional and friendly staff who took time to show us our room before we committed to anything. The room we took was on the top floor with ample privacy and a cool breeze coming in from the east, off the shores of the Bosphorous; we also had our own little balcony. Our stay was made even more comfortable when the hotel offered to cordon off the hammam downstairs for us. We were supplied with bathrobes and towels and all other essentials, so all we had to do was take ourselves down there straight from our room!The hotel took great care in catering for our privacy, bringing in a female masseuse for me and a male masseur for my husband. We opted for a full hammam service, which included use of the showers and sauna, followed by a steam, scrub and massage. Both masseurs were highly professional made us feel very relaxed (especially the female masseuse, as I was pregnant at the time and she took a lot of care in making sure I was okay!) As for the food, I have to say it was the best food in the area of Sultanahmet. We tried a few other places but nothing else compared to what we epxerienced at our very own hotel. Our package came with a full breakfast option, which was great - we had the option of choosing from a range of hot and continental breakfasts, or making up our own (something the waiters and chef are very good at). We also had lunch and dinner there on a couple of occasions and each time the food was perfect. The staff were very helpful and made it a highly enjoyable experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good deal in the heart of the historic city of Istanbul (I'll definitely be going back for my next spa break!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spacious Room, Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: cayman8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Premier with two friends from April 25 through May 3, 2009. This is a relatively new hotel on a busy, primarily pedestrian street in the Old City within a few blocks of the major Sultanahmet tourist sites. A tram system stop is located about 3 blocks away, but we found ourselves walking to the Old City historical sites. The room was spacious and clean, easily accommodating three adult males. The staff was friendly and very helpful. There is a fine view of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya from the top floor terrace, which the staff graciously opened for us on request, even providing private beverage service. The breakfast buffet provided good local meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables and breads, as well as scrambled eggs with various added ingredients. We had our first meal in the hotel's restaurant and enjoyed it, as well. The street below is a combination of small hotels, restaurants with indoor/outdoor seating and youth hostels. It can get pretty noisy, particularly on Friday and Saturday nights, so if you are sensitive to noise, request a room that does not front the street. We had a room overlooking the street, but found that the windows shut out much of the noise below. We had no trouble sleeping, but others might. The street on which the hotel is located has probably a dozen restaurants to choose from. We used suggestions in Frommer and Lonely Planet some evenings, but alos had good dinners in restaurants chosen at random or because of interesting dishes on their menus. We generally opt for local food, as opposed to sanitized and bland restaurant food and were not disappointed by any of the local restaurants. All in all, this hotel is an excellent value and a fine place to stay. Having free wi-fi was a nice touch, as well.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and charming staff”
Reviews.Author: cpnim
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is in a perfect location and the staff could not have been more helpful. It is situated on a very buzzy street with lots of good restuarants nearby and within walking distance of most of the major sights. Our first floor room was spacious and well equipped with free wii-fii and satellite TV and the included breakfast was fresh and plentiful. There is a small but well equipped fitness centre if you have the energy after walking round the city all day and a sauna and turkish bath with an excellent masseur. All the staff are extrmely helpful and will book tours for you if you want. However you will inevitably end up in a carpet shop despite all your protestations! Istanbul is a fabulous city with something for everyone and this hotel is the perfect base - we thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Classy Hotel within walking distance of Aya Sophia and other great sites!!!!”
Reviews.Author: reconguy
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife really enjoyed this hotel. Its in a nice area right next to Aya Sophia and Topkapi palace. The hotel is a clean, charming, and in a great location. We spent a week here with our 6 year old son, and have nothing but compliments. The hotel is surrounded by good bars and local eateries, and is a short walk to the Metro. The hotel staff is very friendly and engaging, and the free breakfast is pretty good. The chef makes a mean omelette, and the bread and cheese is quite nice. Me and my wife plan on staying here next year when we revisit istanbul. P.S-We all enjoyed the Turkish bath and Spa downstairs. Also Free WiFi!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: nikosioannidis
Reviews.Content: Great location for sightseeing - very close to all the main attractions. The hotel stands out among the rest located in the area. Staff - very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are beautifully decorated - and even the executive suites have a jacuzzi bathtub. Using the hamam for yourself free of charge (by booking it an hour in advance) is definitely the highpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CRUICKSHANK
Reviews.Content: This small but intimate hotel was the most perfect location for visiting the main tourist attractions. The staff were delightful and really nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast offered was extensive and dinner in this hotel represented excellent value for money. We wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Had wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Falajoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, staff attentive and helpful, food was great, rooms lovely. Spa facilities very good. Within walking distance of many tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, small hotel, in walking distance of many of the major old town attractions”
Reviews.Author: GarryCann
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very friendly and helpfull from the second we arrived, taking us through all the hotel amenaties and showing us around the spa. Our room was just as advertised with a small suit, jacuzzi bath and balcony with a sea view, although bear in mind that rooms at the back of the hotel do not have such views. The hotel is built to a very good standard, with very nice rooms, good facilities and pleasant restaurant, with a sauna that is very usefull after a long day walking in cold February temperatures. The hotel is also ideally locate for many of the main attractions of the old town, with restaurants and bazars also in walking distance. A very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spa facilities for a winter trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: maas1
Reviews.Content: If you happen to be in Istanbul during the colder period of the year, the spa facilities of this hotel are just what you need after a day sightseeing. The very friendly staff provided great service and the location is just perfect for the major sights. Rooms are clean and comfortable (we did not have a seaview but because of the bad weather it didn't make a difference to us). Very good restaurant next door (left hand side).

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful little hotel in a lovely little street.”
Reviews.Author: globaltheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: This rather new hotel is a small but beautiful place to stay, located in one of the best quarters of Istanbul ( around the corner of the Topkapi Palace). Rooms are decorated in local style and very comforatble, Coffee & tea facilities F.O.C. good beds, good sitting area, although I had a room at the inner court it did not bother me because it was all very nicely decorated with plants and wood. Bathrooms are spacious and nicely decorated. Small bar area were they serve food, including breakfast. Nice terrace in front of the hotel. One of those hotels were you get real personal service! The four stars are really in place. The Spa is not overwhelming, it is very small. But again staff service is excellent.The street were the hotel is located is a very nice traditional small street, with a lot of nice shops that also include some good Turkish design. And walking through the small streets to the Topkapi Palace gardens is a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to help create the perfect trip!”
Reviews.Author: PLS_traveler
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, Istanbul Archaeology Museum and pieces of history dating back 8000 years, the Best Western Premier Regency Suites and Spa open opportunities to walk through history and enjoy some of the most amazing sites of Turkey. A short walk to the tram allows you to venture out to the Gallata Tower, the fish market, spice market or the Grand Bazaar. Don't forget to go to see the whirling dervishes perform and view the art exhibits at the Istanbul Modern. The best start for your day begins with an array of fresh fruits, olives, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, cheeses, a variety of breads and eggs made to order. Each time you approach the door prepare for the most gracious staff who offers tea, coffee, other refreshments and the cordial assurance of "Your happiness is our happiness!" The restaurant offers a wide variety of delicious entrees that cause you to look forward to the next meal so that you can try one more of the selections. The hotel offers a fitness area complete with sauna, Turkish bath, exercise equipment and the availability of a massage, manicure and pedicure. After enjoying an evening of sites, sounds and smells, an immaculately clean room with crisp, clean sheets awaits you. If there is anything that you need or have forgotten, the staff is ready and willing to take care of your needs. When it is time to leave, you will feel like you have a new home away from home and good friends who just happen to work at the Best Western Premier Regency Suites and Spa! To the staff, I say "Tesekkur ederim! Thank you!" The trip was much more memorable because of the special treatment I received while staying in their delightful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, extremely friendly staff - GREAT Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: CBV_Europe
Reviews.Content: In the tiny streets of historic Sultanahmet, a few steps away from Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, this hotel has an extraordinarily friendly staff and is perfect to explore the entire city. We were delighted about every aspect of the hotel, it is small, cozy but the rooms are nice sized and the bathrooms excellent. The extremely nice and knowledgeable front desk staff helped us find a good place to eat, get around on the super-efficient trams, get delicious Baklava - and were also very helpful when the Internet in the whole area broke down and I desperately needed a work-related email. We could not have been happier and would most certainly stay here again - we recommended it to friends who live in Istanbul and hope that they send friends there. The breakfast was also good and the service terrific. The rooms are a bit dark, but I think that is atmosphere rather than a problem. Great long weekend, thanks in good part to this hotel and its staff!

Reviews.Title: “Charming central location, great service...”
Reviews.Author: themin
Reviews.Content: We were at the Regency Suites for 5 nights over Xmas. We had earlier asked for early checked in about 9am, after a long 14 hours flight from Singapore. To our pleasant surprise, a room was available and we were invited to have breakfast on check-in day. We were allocated an "executive suite" facing the street on the 2nd floor. Room was big, charming and clean. However, there are plenty of noise throughout the night and we mentioned this to the receptionist the next day just before breakfast (which was decent, but little variety if you stay for many days). After breakfast, we were offered a higher room with balcony on the top floor. It was a smaller room, but the balcony was great. Location wise, being in Sultanahmet, very close to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi and Haghia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique at its best”
Reviews.Author: jamhead
Reviews.Content: A small boutique hotel, recently opened, situated in a very convenient part of the old city. Beautifully appointed, very clean with extremely friendly and helpful staff. Very adequate buffet breakfast included in the tariff. Plans to open a roof garden restaurant with wonderful views over the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Vittorio & Cinzia (Italy)”
Reviews.Author: vittoriosim
Reviews.Content: We really suggest this hotel. We spend 3 wonderfull days in Istanbul. The hotel is a strategic position on the back of Blue Mosquee. and Arasta Bazar. The rooms are very new and clean and the atmosfhere warm and familiar. The service is professional and the internal restaurant cousine execellent. There is also an inner turkey bath very clean. "If you have any request ask it to Pinar at the lobby, she has a prompt reply for everithing."

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier Regency Suites & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: Akbiyik Cad. No:38 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
